page.title: 20Stanton Park
page.content: Stanton Park is owned by the{Forestry {Commission.}There is a mixture of evergreen and deciduous trees. There is a{Roman Villa}there. In Stanton Park, not far from the Roman Villa is a{Black Pond,}it is called Black Pond because there was a murder there. There were two sailors on leave, one was William Jacques, the other was George Hartford. William Jacques spent all his Â£28, he spent it at the Dragon Inn at Malmesbury. Hartford followed Jacques to Hullavington pub. When they were on their way back to Chippenham they went through Stanton Park. When they got near to the pool, Jacques {murdered}Hartford by hitting him on the head with a hedge stake, he left him by the pool and took his money. He was later caught and hung in Hullavington.
